intro: Laplacea alpestris, commonly known as the alpine laplacea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. This species is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and purple. Laplacea alpestris thrives in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes. Its botanical features make it an important component of alpine ecosystems.
